shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä ḥawi “Book of Ḥawi” (fols. 5ra-329ra) - Introduction (fol. 5ra-rc l.28) - Table of contents of 63 bahlat-sections (fols. 5rc l.29-12rb) - Bahlat 1-17 (fols. 13ra-99vc) - Bahlat 18-34 (fols. 100ra-172vc) - Bahlat 35-63 (fols. 173ra-329ra)
Additiones 1-9.

donors.donor: According to Additio 3 the Ms. was donated by a governor (mäkwännǝn) Wäldä Gäbrǝʾel the grandson of Mikaʾel (Mikaʾel “Sǝḥul”?, ca. 1691-1777) the chief governor of Däbrä Dammo.

dcomments.dcomment: Wäldä Gäbrǝʾel, the donor of the Ms, lived from ca. 1757 to 1788.

txstates.txstate: The sewing is damaged. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 22, 63, 123, 187, 188, 262, 279.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile or paper inlays. Three pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 10 tools were used: double line fillet, triple line fillet, double circle, corni-form, small x, interlaced line fillet, double sine wave with dots, cross hatching, criss cross, palmette, floral arabesque).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (of slit-type) are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible (e.g., fols. 9r, 18r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine but irregular; hand b: mediocre, careless, ill-trained; hand c: mediocre, careful

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: At least two distinct hands were involved in copying the Ms., hands a and b. It is difficult to say whether hands a and c are the same hand or, whether hand c is a variant of hand a. Hand a: fols. 5ra-237vc (apart from the fols. written in hand b), 250ra-302vc, 316ra-329ra: the letters are slender, tall and upright (occasionally right-sloping e.g., fol. 253vbc), but they are written inconsistently in a variety of ways. The script is uneven and irregular throughout the Ms. It is usually neat and careful at the beginning of the quire and then gradually deteriorates. On fol. 22vb the letters are executed with a thinner nib. On fols. 100ra-101rb the letters are slightly bigger and written with a broader pen nib. Hand b: fols. 20rc-21rc, 23vc, 24rbc, 25rv, 27rbc, 28vab, 29vb-vc, 76rc-vb, 77va, 78ra, 78vbc, 79va-vb, 80ra, 84rv, 92va-95rc, 95vc-98rb: on numerous fols. the script is conspicuously right-sloping. Hand c: fols. 238ra-249vc, 304ra-315vc: the letters are short and wide, broadly spaced and slightly right-sloping. On fol. 315v the scribe used a compressed script to accommodate 66 lines of text within 39 ruled lines.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; a few lines (alternating with black lines) and a group of lines in the incipit page, and on fols. 13r, 100r, 173r; names of sections (bahǝlat “discourses”) followed by the sequence number and occasionally the initial line on fols. 5rc l.29-12rb; a few lines (alternating with black lines) or a group of lines of the incipit of the sections; two initial lines of the subsections; the words täsǝʾlo “enquired him” and täśäṭwo “answered him”; two initial lines of the colophon of the work (fol. 12rab); elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Colophon of the work concerning the translation from Greek into Arabic (cf. Orient. 778, fol. 20a col. 3 [WrBriMus 235-254, no 348, esp. 253a]). Fol. 12ra: ወጠንኩ፡ አነ፡ ነዳይ፡ ወምስኪን፡ በጽሒፈ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እንዘ፡ እትራዳእ፡ በእግዚአብሔር… Fol. 12rb: ወወጠንኩ፡ አነ፡ ሕፁፅ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ወልደ፡ በትረክ፡ በጽሒፈ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ አመ፡ ሀሎኩ፡ በደብረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወዓቢይ፡ እንጦንዮስ፡ በገዳመ፡ ዓረብ፡ በፍጻሜሁ፡ ለሚያዝያ፡ በዓመት፡ ፱፻፹ወ፫፡ እምሰማዕታት፡ ንጹሐን፡ በየኅብር፡ ምስለ፡ ወርኃ፡ ረጀብ፡ እብናዊ፡ በዓመት፡ ፮፻፷ወ፭፡ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አሜን። It states that Gabrǝʾel Wäldä Bäträk commenced the translation of the book from Greek into Arabic in 983 year of martyrs during his stay in the St Anthony monastery. - Colophon of the work concerning the translation from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz (cf. Orient. 778, fol. 245b [WrBriMus 235-254, no 348, esp. 253b-254]). Fol. 329ra: ተፈጸመ፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ትርጓሜ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሐዊ፡ እም፡ ልሳነ፡ ዓረቢ፡ ኀበ፡ ልሳነ፡ ግዕዝ፡ በዓመት፡ ፸፻ወ፪፻ወ፷፡ እም፡ ፍጥረተ፡ ዓለም፡ ዘከመ፡ ሐሳቦሙ፡ ለቅብጣውያን፡ ወዮናናውያን It states that the book was translated from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz in 7260 from the creation of the world, according to the calculation of the Copts and the Greeks.

additional.cont: Fol. 2ra-rb: List of ingredients for preparing nug-oil (?).
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a mediocre hand, the same as Additio 2. It is dated to 1864 A.M. (=1871/72 A.D.) when the king was Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89). Five initial lines contain an instruction on the usage of abbreviations for the units of measure: gwǝlm, kwǝrzo and ǝkkul (“half”). It is followed by a list of various ingredients and their quantity. In the end, it mentions four fathers in charge of the monastery administration.

additional.cont: Fol. 2rc: Record concerning tributes established by King Yoḥannəs IV for Däbrä Dammo (?).
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a mediocre hand, the same as Additio 1. It contains a list of items donated by King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89) to the monastery. According to the instruction given at the beginning, some of the goods are measured in a unit called “kwalba” (also “kwälba”).

additional.cont: Fol. 2v ls.1-5: Donation note.
additional.det: The note is written in a mediocre hand. It states that the Book of Ḥawi was donated by a governor (mäkwännǝn) Wäldä Gäbrǝʾel the son of the son (grandchild) of Mikaʾel (Mikaʾel “Sǝḥul”?, ca. 1691-1777) the chief governor of Däbrä Dammo.

additional.cont: Fol. 2v ls.5-13: Inventory of the monastery's property.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a mediocre hand and in a big script. It was drawn up during the tenure of mämḥǝr Gäbrä Mädḫǝn and comprises of paraphernalia, with their quantity, and the general number of books (for some books the titles are given).

additional.cont: Fol. 2v l.5: Inventories of the monastery's property.
additional.det: The notes are written in the same mediocre hand. They were drawn up during the tenure of abbot (mämḥǝr) Zä-Yoḥannǝs. The inventories comprise of paraphernalia, with their quantity, and the general number of books housed in the monastery.

additional.cont: Fol. 2vc: Reconciliation note.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a mediocre hand. It is dated to 1918 [A.M.] (= 1925/26 A.D.).

additional.cont: Fol. 3r: Regulation concerning the office of the Däbrä Dammo gäbäz.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a mediocre hand and in a big script. It was drawn up during the tenure of abbot (mämḥǝr) Zä-Yoḥannǝs. It deals with the length of the office of the gäbäz, the possibility of its prolongation and the salary for the gäbäz.

additional.cont: Fol. 4r: Scribe’s note on the quantity of skins and/or parchment for writing.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic and in Gǝʾǝz, in the main hand, in a small script. The 2nd and the 3rd lines are crossed out. The note states that the number of delivered skins is 40. Ten skins are allocated for Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus.

additional.cont: Fol. 329v: Reconciliation note.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a mediocre hand. It is dated to 1927 year of mercy (=1934/35 A.D.) during the tenure of abbot Gäbrä Maryam. Three small ornaments are drawn above and below the note.
